conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_A. I’m very interested in joining School_E because I value a supportive environment where I can contribute actively to school life and grow academically. School_E is one of my top choices, and if admitted I’m ready to commit and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I have the lowest priority there, so an early [APPLY] is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students also apply. School_C is my second choice and I’m also last in their priority, so similarly risky. School_E is my 4th choice but I am ranked #1 in School_E’s priority, so applying there now should secure a match quickly and avoid ending up at my last choice or unmatched if competition is intense elsewhere. I will apply to School_E and express clear commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your interest in School_E. We’re pleased to offer you admission and would be excited to have you join our community.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_A is #1 on School_E’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and an [APPLY] from Student_A in round 1. Accepting immediately secures our top choice and avoids the risk Student_A matches elsewhere (their preferences rank School_E 4th, so they could be taken by other schools later). No higher-ranked candidate exists, so there is no strategic benefit to waiting.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee. I’m Student_C and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would gladly accept an offer if selected. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. I have relatively strong priority there (School_B ranks me 3rd, behind Student_E and Student_B). If I delay, Student_B (who ranks School_B 2nd) could take the only seat after failing at School_A, and Student_E is also highly ranked at School_B. Applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before competition escalates.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. We appreciate your strong interest and are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.
conversation.thought: Student_C is 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (after Student_E and Student_B). However, Student_C is explicitly applying now and states School_B is first choice, so acceptance would lock in a reasonably high-priority match and eliminate the risk of ending unmatched if higher-priority students never apply. Given quota=1 and no other applicants in this round, accepting Student_C is a safe, high-quality outcome, even though it forgoes the chance of Student_E/Student_B later.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions, [APPLY]

School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining your community. I’m looking for a rigorous academic environment and a school culture where I can contribute consistently and grow. If admitted, I would be committed to enrolling and participating actively in classes and school activities.

Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but School_B’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C). Since each school has capacity 1 and everyone will likely apply to top choices immediately, applying to School_B now is unlikely to succeed. My next choice is School_C, where I am ranked 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_C), giving me a better chance than at School_B. I will apply to School_C in round 1 to secure a high-preference match before seats fill, emphasizing strong fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your interest in School_C. After reviewing our current admissions priorities and available capacity for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your time and wish you the very best with your other applications.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list is B > C > D > E > A. I have quota 1. Student_D is acceptable and ranks 3rd, but it is only round 1 and Student_B and Student_C both rank above D and also list School_C as their 3rd and 2nd choice respectively. There is a meaningful chance they will apply to me soon (especially Student_C, whose 2nd choice is School_C). If I accept Student_D now, I lose the option to admit a higher-priority student later. Therefore I should reject Student_D at this time to preserve capacity for higher-ranked applicants.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_A and believe I would be a strong fit for your community. I would be excited to accept an offer and commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). With capacity 1, applying immediately to School_C risks rejection if higher-priority students apply. By contrast, School_A ranks me 1st overall, so an immediate application to School_A is very likely to be accepted and would secure me a strong outcome (3rd on my true list) rather than risking ending up much lower. Therefore I will apply to School_A now to lock in a safe, high-quality match.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. We would be excited to have you join our community.

School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list and has applied with a clear commitment. Although Student_B also applied and ranks School_A first, Student_B is ranked below Student_E (#4). With quota 1, accepting Student_E immediately secures our top-choice match and dominates any alternative outcome given full information.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and I’m formally applying. School_A is my first-choice school, and if accepted I will enroll. I’m especially excited about the academic rigor and community, and I’m ready to contribute strongly in class and in extracurriculars. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_D, Student_A), delaying would only reduce my chance if higher-priority students apply first. I will apply now and emphasize strong fit and commitment to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. At this time, we have filled our available seat and are unable to extend an offer of admission.

We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in your placement process.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and has already matched with Student_E this round via mutual APPLY/ACCEPT. Student_E is also the top choice on School_A’s true priority list, so even absent the quota constraint, this is the best possible match. With remaining quota = 0, rules require rejecting any new APPLY. Therefore, Student_B must be rejected despite ranking above Student_C and being interested in School_A.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and I’m formally applying. School_C is one of my top remaining choices, and if accepted I will enroll. I’m excited by School_C’s academic environment and would be eager to contribute both in the classroom and through extracurriculars. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_A already rejected me. From the remaining unmatched schools, School_C is higher on my true preference list than School_D. Also, School_C’s priority ranking places me first, so a formal application should be accepted if they still have capacity. Therefore I will apply to School_C with a clear commitment to enroll if admitted.

Accepting now secures our top-choice match and there is no higher-ranked student to wait for. Student_B also states they will enroll if accepted, reducing risk. Therefore accept immediately.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: Only School_C and School_D remain unmatched. School_D is on my true preference list (though last), while School_C already rejected me and is also likely to prioritize others over me. Since I prefer any listed school to being unmatched, I should apply to School_D now. I also have strong priority at School_D (they rank Student_D first), so an [APPLY] should secure a match immediately.

conversation.message:

Congratulations—we look forward to welcoming you to School_D.

conversation.thought: Student_D is my top choice on School_D's true priority list. I have quota 1 and no current match. Student_D has applied directly; accepting now secures the best possible outcome for School_D and eliminates the risk of losing them to other schools in later rounds. No higher-priority student exists, so there is no reason to delay or reject.
